result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aleczander M Watson-Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Aleczander M Watson-Wright.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  However, on State's motion and for the purpose of sentencing, Court ordered case DISMISSED BUT READ IN.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, appeared in person. Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared  by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record by Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 04-25-2022

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Arredondo.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with MPD Distric 3 Police station & police officers unless in a professional capacity
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexander M Watson-Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Alexander M Watson-Wright not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22 @ 1p
